title: Gladiators' Cobra admits he was often 'bleeding drunk' while battling contestants

Gladiators star Cobra has admitted he was often "bleeding drunk" while he battled contestants on the hit TV show.

The athlete - real name Michael Wilson - was part of the original Gladiators line-up when it started in 1992.

But while he was super fit and had rippling muscles, Cobra says he'd often struggle to chase contestants up the infamous 32ft-high wall because he was so drunk

The 55-year-old told The Guardian : "I remember looking at The Wall and thinking, 'I've got to chase this guy up it and I'm bleeding drunk'."

Cobra says some of his fellow stars took it very seriously though.

(Image: Daily Record)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

He added: "Hunter, the swot, would be up there early in the morning, practising on the Wall. That’s why he used to catch everyone."

Cobra says when bosses found out about his boozing they wanted to ask him, but the production crew stood up for him and he kept his job until 2000.

The star has told before about how he and the other Gladiators used to party hard behind the scenes.

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

He said: "We never had to drive anywhere, we had hospitality twice a day so there would be wine and booze and stuff flowing.

"Ironically, I never used to drink a drop before I joined Gladiators."

Earlier this year, Cobra was seriously ill and battling pneumonia in hospital.

At the time, he blamed his illness on his punishing workouts for the ITV show.

(Image: BBC)

He told The Sun : "I’m only half a Gladiator now. It’s been touch and go.

"I don’t feel like I’m kicking the bucket at the minute, but it will only take another cold or cough and I’m in trouble."

He added: "I’m isolated in my own ward. It goes to show – you never know what’s around the corner."

He later needed hip surgery.
